title: Heat Metal

Level 2 Transmutation Spell

Cause a metal weapon or armour to glow red-hot and force the creature touching it to let go or receive Disadvantage on Attack Rolls and Ability Checks.

If the creature is only wearing metal armour, it always receives Disadvantage.

If the creature is still touching the metal, you can use a bonus action on subsequent turns to deal another 2~16 Fire damage and force the creature to let go or receive Disadvantage.

18m CON Save Concentration

Heat Metal is a Spell in Baldur's Gate 3. Heat Metal is a Lvl 2 Spell from the Transmutation school. Spells can be used for dealing damage to Enemies, inflict Status Ailments, buff Characters or interact with the environment.

Heat Metal Information

Description: Cause a metal weapon or armour to glow red-hot and force the creature touching it to let go or receive Disadvantage on Attack Rolls and Ability Checks. If the creature is only wearing metal armour, it always receives Disadvantage. If the creature is still touching the metal, you can use a bonus action on subsequent turns to deal another 2~16 Fire damage and force the creature to let go or receive Disadvantage. Level: Lvl 2 spell School: Transmutation School Casting Time: Action Duration: 10 turns Range: 18m Requires Concentration: Yes Saving Throw: Constitution

Heat Metal (Condition)

Metal weapons are dropped if the weilder fails their Saving Throw. If the target is touching the heated metal, they receive Disadvantage on Attack Rolls and Ability Checks. Every turn the target is touching the heated metal, the caster can use a Bonus Action to deal another 2d8 Fire damage, forcing the target to Save or drop the weapon.
